name: 4,5-dimethoxy-3-iodobenzaldehyde
Reason: 4,5-dimethoxy-3-iodobenzaldehyde has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzaldehyde, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The methoxy groups (–O–) add approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The iodine atom (I) introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +20°C. The carbonyl group (C=O) introduces polar interactions, contributing approximately +30°C. The methoxy group (–O–) adds approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
